ask yourself  what you can do to change.  1) drive you car less to none 2) isolate your home (if you live in the north) 3 ) eat local grown food and less meat 4) buy local products (or consume less) 5) work from home if possible 6) spend holiday close to home. 7) reduce population .... any other ideas?  if we all do 4 things of this list..  then we are getting some where...

when I went to school in the late 60s and early 70s we where tought of a coming Iceage, I am still waiting for this, now its global warming, we hear a lot about raising ocean levels.

What a bunch of propaganda claptrap. If you want to take some measures to adapt to the small amount of warming seen, fine. But in reality, there have been very few measurable effects from that small warming. The idea that we're going to be net zero by 2050 (or 2030 as some politicians claim) is pure fantasy. We'd have to go to a pre-industrial way of living to meet those goals.
Like all plaques, they all have a breaking point. Incluiding the human plaque.

The reality we face is not the phoney CO2 3 degree C rise but the 13 degrees C DROP. We are thousands of years past the average time interglacial warm periods last. When the COLD of the end of the interglacial begins, temperatures drop fast. To full glacial cold in less than a century, and possibly in as short a time as a decade.

"The climate system is a coupled non-linear chaotic system, and therefore the long-term prediction of future climate states is not possible."
IPCC 2003

This is something Corporate Media and The Narrative never talk about.
